intro: Scleria hirtella var. strigosa, commonly known as the hairy bulrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stems and dense clusters of small, spike-like flowers. Its leaves are typically hairy and grass-like, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in wet or marshy environments, often found near water bodies in its natural habitat.
